member.name: FILTERKEYS
member.summary: Contains information about the FilterKeys accessibility feature, which enables a user with disabilities to set the keyboard repeat rate (RepeatKeys), acceptance delay (SlowKeys), and bounce rate (BounceKeys).

member.name: FILTERKEYS.cbSize
member.summary: Specifies the structure size, in bytes.

summary.para: A set of bit flags that specify properties of the FilterKeys feature. The following bit-flag values are defined:

listheader.description: The computer makes a click sound when a key is pressed or accepted. If SlowKeys is on, a click is generated when the key is pressed and again when the keystroke is accepted.
Windows 95/98, Windows 2000: A confirmation dialog box appears when the FilterKeys features are activated by using the hot key.
The user can turn the FilterKeys feature on and off by holding down the RIGHT SHIFT key for eight seconds.
If this flag is set, the computer plays a siren sound when the user turns the FilterKeys feature on or off by using the hot key.
Windows 95, Windows 2000: A visual indicator is displayed when the FilterKeys features are on.

member.name: FILTERKEYS.iWaitMSec
member.summary: Specifies the length of time, in milliseconds, that the user must hold down a key before it is accepted by the computer.

member.name: FILTERKEYS.iDelayMSec
member.summary: Specifies the length of time, in milliseconds, that the user must hold down a key before it begins to repeat.

member.name: FILTERKEYS.iRepeatMSec
member.summary: Specifies the length of time, in milliseconds, between each repetition of the keystroke.

member.name: FILTERKEYS.iBounceMSec
member.summary: Specifies the length of time, in milliseconds, that must elapse after releasing a key before the computer will accept a subsequent press of the same key.
